alert.note: Alert for Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:56PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sioux and east central Goshen Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 256 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Morrill, or 12 miles east of Torrington, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Sioux and east central Goshen Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
